intro: Croton icabarui, commonly known as the icabarui croton, is a tropical shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often brightly colored leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in complex inflorescences. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. However, it is important to note that some parts of the plant may be toxic.
